job_description: Open Source - Data Architect - job post Verizon 31,230 reviews Irving, TX 75038 $128,000 - $237,000 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $128,000 - $237,000 a year Job Type Full-time When you join Verizon Verizon is one of the world's leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We're a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here. What you’ll be doing... The Open Source Program Office is seeking for a Principal Engineer / Open Source Data Architect to play a critical role that interacts with development teams across the company with the goal of driving the analysis and tracking of open source component use. You will engage with teams across the enterprise to standardize, connect, and harmonize the existing approaches for tracking open source components and drive the development and implementation of meaningful metrics. You will work closely with your peers in the Open Source Program Office who are driving the secure supply chain and component viability efforts, focused on tooling, tracking, and metrics. You will be responsible for the overall prioritization of efforts regarding the full breadth of components in use across Verizon, including understanding, documenting, and highlighting the necessary trade-offs and proposing effective solutions to improve the security and compliance of our open source environments. You will be part of a cross-group virtual team focused on engineering innovative, strategic, and long-term solutions that align with (and often expand) Verizon enterprise architecture standards. You will work collaboratively with all stakeholders to establish and maintain technical leadership within the enterprise technology teams. You will also work closely with your peers on implementing policies and establishing best practices for the use of open source software components in all stages of the development lifecycle. Additionally, you will mentor and coach engineers at all levels across the organization to better understand the existing industry standard processes and policies around open source use. Analyzing the various efforts on open source component tracking across the enterprise. Acting as the driving force behind the harmonization and integration of those efforts. Ensuring complete coverage across all parts of the business, focusing on prioritizing the target efforts appropriately. Maintaining and promoting best practices around use of and contribution to third party open source projects. Identifying key components and processes to improve the overall maintainability, security, and compliance of the Verizon open source supply chain. Providing mentorship and coaching in order to establish best practices for component maintainability and upgradability. Working as part of a broader effort to establish and review viability criteria for open source components (based on the OpenSSF framework, among others). Working with the OSPO leadership on the overall open source related strategies. Where you’ll be working… This is a work-from-home role performed almost exclusively from your home office with occasional in-person meetings and training. What we’re looking for... You’ll need to have: Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience. Six or more years of relevant work experience. Experience in data science, analytics, and common tools in this field. Experience in engaging with and contributing to open source projects. Experience in doing code review and giving constructive feedback to other developers. Experience in developing metrics out of data from a variety of backend services. Even better if you have one or more of the following: Bachelor’s / Masters’ degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field Experience in giving or participating in public presentations and participation in open source events. Experience in working on use of open source components in enterprise environments. Experience in software development practices in one or more programming languages. Experience in working databases, REST APIs, and similar automated data services. Experience in working with workflow solutions like ServiceNow, Jira, or similar. Experience in Python or other tooling languages. Experience in working with open source security (and software security in general). Experience in articulating the business drives and architectural approach/trade-offs during discussions for solution. Experience in facilitating group meetings/discussions. If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above. Compensation Our benefits are designed to help you move forward in your career, and in areas of your life outside of Verizon. From health and wellness benefit options including: medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability, basic life insurance, supplemental life insurance, AD&D insurance, identity theft protection, pet insurance and group home & auto insurance. We also offer a matched 401(k) savings plan, stock incentive programs, up to 8 company paid holidays per year and up to 6 personal days per year, parental leave, adoption assistance and tuition assistance, plus other incentives, we’ve got you covered with our award-winning total rewards package. Newly hired employees receive up to 15 days of vacation per year, which grows with additional service. For part-timers, your coverage will vary as you may be eligible for some of these benefits depending on your individual circumstances. If you are hired into a Washington work location, the salary range for this position is between $128,000 and$237,000 based on a full-time schedule. The salary will vary depending on your location and confirmed job-related skills and experience. This position is eligible for an annual performance-based bonus. For part-time roles, your compensation will be adjusted to reflect your hours. Equal Employment Opportunity We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.

Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $93,000 - $120,000 a year Job Type Full-time Title : SOFTWARE ENGINER – ALGORITHMS Work Location: Addison, Tx Division & Department: ENGINEERING Position Reports to: DIRECTOR, ENGINEERING COMPANY VALUES All Authentix employees are expected to embrace our Company values in the performance of their respective tasks and duties. Always with integrity .......Authentixians value: Teaming and collaboration Advancing science and technology - for a better world Dedicating ourselves to our clients’ success Competing and winning in the marketplace JOB SUMMARY The Software Engineer, Algorithms will work closely with the members of a multi-disciplinary engineering team throughout the development process, from supporting initial proposals and feasibility studies through algorithm development, implementation, validation, optimization and system deployment. The Software Engineer, Algorithms develops image recognition and processing algorithms for complex sensor systems for use in high-speed banknote processing machines. The algorithms detect and measure specific banknote features from high resolution images. In addition, this position consults and develops algorithms to support solutions for other business fields within the company. SUMMARY OF ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS The essential functions listed below are representative of the functions that must be performed in order to satisfactorily fulfill the purpose of this job. Additional functions and duties may be assumed or assigned from time to time. Develop high-speed image and signal processing algorithms to detect and measure specific features, defects, and characteristics of banknotes and secure documents Partner with other engineering team members to architect, develop and implement the overall solution Participate in technical discussions with customers to determine requirements for algorithm performance while carefully balancing the customer’s use case with the technical capabilities of the system Bring forward creative ideas and drive innovation Determine the approach for validating and verifying system performance Optimize image processing end to end system performance Research and resolve complex system and software problems KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. This is an exciting opportunity to join the Textron infrastructure team as an Infrastructure Analyst. We are looking for a talented candidate that can effectively support Textron’s current Midrange and Collaboration environments. RESPONSIBILITIES Assist the lead midrange architect responsible for designing and implementing server, storage, and messaging solutions. Cross-train with other team members in day-to-day team operations. Enforce standards for system architecture in close collaboration with application owners, developers, end-users and stakeholders. Implement solutions in keeping with long-term strategic plan for midrange system management and platform maturity, including automation through scripting and coding, virtualization, business continuity/disaster recovery, and cost optimization. Server management for a limited scope of internally managed systems (such as Windows, UNIX, Linux, etc.) Appliance management for a limited scope of internally managed appliances (such as ODA, Storage, Riverbed, etc.) Hypervisor management for a limited scope of internally managed host systems (such as VMware, Hyper-V, VIO, etc.) EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE A Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology or related field is required. The ideal employee will be highly self-motivated and directed. advocate and voice for client requirements when collaborating with internal engineering and product management stakeholders for future feature requests Field incoming incident inquiries and collaborate with Customer Success, System Reliability, and Engineering teams to ensure timely resolution, while communicating effectively with customers Maintain strong technical knowledge of Citrus’ product offerings and be able to mentor staff on best practices, preferred configurations, and next steps for customer issues Provide pre-sales support to the Sales team to secure the “technical close” in the customer sales cycle Provide post-sales strategic technical guidance to build solutions for complex problems and collaborating with all stakeholders: clients, internal account management, and engineering teams Maintain internal and external documentation surrounding all client integrations About you: We are looking for a Technical Account Manager who has the following In North America, a large majority of our team is located in Florida with many others in Los Angeles, Chicago, New York, Atlanta, Pennsylvania, Toronto-CA, Vermont and more.
